page.title: 08St. Bernardines Church
page.content: Franciscans were{ formed in 1219}and first came to England in 1224. The {school}in Buckingham was built in{1894 starting with 8 pupils, numbers rose to 100. In 1970 they bought a {Victorian {house}in Chandos Road. The new church was built adjacent to the house and was opened in 1974. The old school and church was eventually bought by the University. The tabernacle,font,organ, bell, pews and two statues of St. Bernadine were all brought from the old church. The{stations of the cross}are in one continuous fresco. It was painted by a commercial artist in modern style. He {also} painted the{crucifixion picture over the altar.There are three priests and one brother living in the friary. They serve Aynho,Brackley,Kings Sutton and Buckingham.
